availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. McGoodwin (Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, attorney. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Son of David W. McGoodwin and Susan C. B. D. Wigginton McGoodwin. Graduate of Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1849. Student in Caldwell County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Attorney with David W. McGoodwin in Princeton in 1860. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 280B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 816.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 116.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 218B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 20.
The Twelfth Triennial and Thirty-Sixth Annual Catalogue of the Officers and Students of Centre College at Danville, Kentucky, 1860 (Danville: Cincinnati Gazette Steam Print,1860), 21.
Find A Grave, "James P. McGoodwin (1830-1861)," Memorial #191446918, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/191446918 (accessed March 24, 2021).
